text: good morning everyone today I want to
talk a little bit about how social media
has ruined me and I think I'm speaking
for a lot of people not just myself let
me give you an example I'm here in South
Toma it's a beautiful African ivanishin
off the western coast of Gabon in the
middle of the sea and yesterday I woke
up someone at my guesthouse here told me
that the equator runs through the
southern part so I said awesome I would
love to go there let me check it out so
I hopped in a taxi and I went down there
and I decided to make a video about it
and you know as I was sitting there in
the taxi looking out the window it's
such a beautiful island and instead of
taking in the beauty I was just thinking
about the video I was gonna make and the
Instagram post I was gonna post and it
completely took away from the moment
even when I got to the equator it was in
the middle of this beautiful you know
beautiful landscape and on this mountain
and coconut trees everywhere and instead
I'm just videoing everything and taking
selfies and thinking about that and when
I got back last night I just realized
that men I would have had the most
incredible day ever but instead I was so
focused on the video in social media
that I don't even know what I did saw so
that's just one example
and it's been catching up to me a lot
and I think that social media is ruining
I guess you could say a large part of
our generation six years ago when I took
my first trip abroad to Prague Czech
Republic where I've studied abroad I
didn't even own a camera I didn't have a
social media presence and it was
incredible I remember every single
moment in detail every place that I went
every experience that
it was completely raw and authentic and
very very very enjoyable fast-forward to
now and the complete opposite has
happened because of social media to be
honest I can't really go one day without
posting I can't even go one day without
internet it is completely taking over my
life and it has kind of drained what
traveling is because to be honest
traveling is my passion filmmaking and
posting on social media is not I
understand you know there's two ends to
the story because I understand that I've
made social media and videos my
full-time job and I'm very thankful for
that
so it's kind of a catch-22 because on
one hand I feel like I want to quit
making videos and quit social media on
the other hand its funding the bills and
it's letting me travel more so I don't
think I'm gonna stop I think I might cut
back a little bit but I just want to be
vulnerable and tell you guys what goes
through my brain because I know that I'm
not the only one that suffers this so
many people have made a living on social
media and for whatever it's worth I
think you could be ruining us especially
in regards to travel because travel is
just meant to be just to go out there
meet people step out your comfort zone
and try new things and while I'm still
doing that there's always this pressure
on my shoulders to continue producing
content for you guys to watch it just
leads to a very stressful life and I've
developed anxiety in many situations I'm
noticing that I'm super anxious I'm
tapping my feet I'm grinding my teeth
and you know and I'm always trying to
move so fast because time is so valuable
to me because I need to spend basically
six hours editing everyday and filming
and finding people to film with and
writing scripts so it's just a lot to
comprehend also I think everyone at this
point in time wants to be an influencer
and it's
kind of really annoying especially on
Instagram you have all these people
posting fake photos and photos inside of
hotels that they can't even afford
themselves but they're getting it
sponsored it's just creating this
illusion and it's I think it's a bubble
and I think the bubble is gonna pop any
day Instagram is really a popularity
contest when you think about it when you
go to someone's profile the first thing
you look at is their follower account I
guarantee it the first time you go to a
new page you look at their follower
account and if they have more than that
means something it's so stupid it
shouldn't mean anything what if someone
is the best photographer or the best
storyteller but they just started an
Instagram today they would be in 0
followers and all of a sudden you would
think that they're not accomplished or
they're not established you know through
video these is something I can be myself
and I can be real because there's no
Photoshop involved and you guys know
what I have you know my personality so I
think that's a way that it kind of
separates from Instagram but nonetheless
I still think that it's a big bubble
that's gonna pop soon and I'm thinking
about the future what I'm gonna do I'm
still focused on visiting every country
and that's always been my number one
passion and I love telling stories with
you guys but it's just been challenging
especially with my view video of you
being down five hundred five hundred
percent still so it's hard to stay
motivated to keep doing this but I'm
gonna keep trucking along I'm very
thankful for social media because it has
let me connect with so many of you like
in Africa here I'm meeting people in
every country through social media so I
don't plan on stopping I think it's an
incredible thing for what it's worth but
I think that in moderation it needs to
be cut back a little bit because
otherwise I'm literally gonna Drive
myself crazy making these videos
posting every five minutes on social
media anyways we'd love to get you guys
thoughts comments reactions on what I
have explained about social media
ruining my life is it ruining your life
also I would love to get some feedback
on if you think I should cut back on
videos and how I can kind of cope with
this in my daily life so thank you so
much for watching and I will see you
guys tomorrow
it's that good I'm Drew Pinsky and if
you like my travel videos please click
Subscribe and join me as I plan to visit
every country in the world
